sentence.Network_en: Let us turn now to the influence of the Mongol conquests.

sentence.Network_en: In the west, a Mongol army invaded eastern Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 在西方, 一支蒙古军队入侵东欧.

sentence.Network_en: Once again Mongol armies threatened Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 蒙古军队再次威胁欧洲.

entry.def: The Mongols were an Asian people who, led by Genghis Khan and Kublai Khan, took control of large areas of China and Central Asia in the 12th and 13th centuries A.D.
Mongol means belonging or relating to the Mongols.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of the nomadic peoples of Mongolia
1. of or relating to the region of Mongolia or its people or their languages or cultures;
